abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Urban and Social
            Rehabilitation Project (PURUS) Development Objective is to
            help DRC (Democratic Republic of Congo) face urgent
            post-elections challenges by (i) providing resources to
            maintain macro-economic stability and fund critical
            expenditures in the immediate future; and (ii) addressing
            urgent rehabilitation and social needs in Kinshasa, which is
            key to political and social stability. The project
            activities are likely to have significant impacts on people,
            livelihood and goods relating to the implementation of roads
            and water infrastructures. They may lead to relocation of
            persons affected by the project (PAP). Sixty pieces of land
            will be affected: they are inhabited by 63 families of
            owners and tenants. All these families will not have to be
            relocated as works will encroach on their land with depth
            which cannot yet be defined in a precise way. These families
            will also lose various assets (houses, shops and other
            facilities, vegetation).
